item.title: Support Mermaid Diagrams
item.description: Mermaid is a diagramming and charting tool, and now is officially supported by our website.
item.content:encoded:
Mermaid is a diagramming and charting tool, and now is officially supported by our website.

See Mermaid Tutorials and play with Mermaid Live Editor.

Sequence Diagram​

Example Mermaid sequence diagram
```mermaid
graph TD;
    A-->B;
    A-->C;
    B-->D;
    C-->D;
```

FlowChart​

Example Mermaid flowchart
```mermaid
flowchart TD
    A[Christmas] -->|Get money| B(Go shopping)
    B --> C{Let me think}
    C -->|One| D[Laptop]
    C -->|Two| E[iPhone]
    C -->|Three| F[fa:fa-car Car]
```

item.title: Support Global Tabs TabItem
item.description: Docusaurus provides ` component and ` component that you can use in Markdown thanks to MDX:
item.content:encoded:
Docusaurus provides <Tabs> component and <TabItem> component that you can use in Markdown thanks to MDX:

We configured it globally so it's a feature available from everywhere.

<Tabs>
  <TabItem value="apple" label="Apple" default>
    This is an apple 🍎
  </TabItem>
  <TabItem value="orange" label="Orange">
    This is an orange 🍊
  </TabItem>
  <TabItem value="banana" label="Banana">
    This is a banana 🍌
  </TabItem>
</Tabs>
This is an apple 🍎 This is an orange 🍊 This is a banana 🍌

item.title: Support Math LaTeX
item.description: Mathematical equations can be rendered using KaTeX, and is official supported on this site from now on.
item.content:encoded:
Mathematical equations can be rendered using KaTeX, and is official supported on this site from now on.

Usage​

Please read KaTeX documentation for more details.

Inline​

Write inline math equations by wrapping LaTeX equations between $:

Let $f\colon[a,b]\to\R$ be Riemann integrable. Let $F\colon[a,b]\to\R$ be
$F(x)=\int_{a}^{x} f(t)\,dt$. Then $F$ is continuous, and at all $x$ such that
$f$ is continuous at $x$, $F$ is differentiable at $x$ with $F'(x)=f(x)$.

Let f ⁣:[a,b]→Rf\colon[a,b] \to \Rf:[a,b]→R be Riemann integrable. Let F ⁣:[a,b]→RF\colon[a,b]\to\RF:[a,b]→R be F(x)=∫axf(t) dtF(x)= \int_{a}^{x} f(t)\,dtF(x)=∫ax​f(t)dt. Then FFF is continuous, and at all xxx such that fff is continuous at xxx, FFF is differentiable at xxx with F′(x)=f(x)F'(x)=f(x)F′(x)=f(x).

Blocks​

For equation block, use line breaks and $$:

$$
I = \int_0^{2\pi} \sin(x)\,dx
$$
I=∫02πsin⁡(x) dxI = \int_0^{2\pi} \sin(x)\,dxI=∫02π​sin(x)dx

item.title: React Support
item.description: Blog posts support Docusaurus Markdown features, such as MDX.
item.content:encoded:
Blog posts support Docusaurus Markdown features, such as MDX.

Interactive​

tip

Use the power of React to create interactive blog posts.

<button onClick={() => alert('button clicked!')}>Click me!</button>

Diagram​

tip

Use the power of React to create diagrams.

import {Chart} from './_assets/snowfall.js';
export const year = 2013;

# Last year’s snowfall

In {year}, the snowfall was above average. It was followed by a warm spring which caused flood conditions in many of the nearby rivers.

<Chart year={year} color="#fcb32c" />;

Last year's snowfall

In 2013, the snowfall was above average. It was followed by a warm spring which caused flood conditions in many of the nearby rivers.

item.title: Welcome
item.description: Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin.
item.content:encoded:
Docusaurus blogging features are powered by the blog plugin.

Use a <!-- truncate --> comment to limit blog post size in the list view.

Simply add Markdown files (or folders) to the blog directory.

Regular blog authors can be added to authors.yml.

The blog post date can be extracted from filenames, such as:

  • 2019-05-30-welcome.md
  • 2019-05-30-welcome/index.md

A blog post folder can be convenient to co-locate blog post images:

The blog supports tags as well!

And if you don't want a blog: just delete this directory, and use blog: false in your Docusaurus config.
